attributes.action: rethink plans to introduce a Broadband-Tax on every broadband user
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As reported by the Times Online (http://technology.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/tech_and_web/article5607744.ece), the government want to create another pointless Quango to "stamp out music and film piracy".

Lord Carter of Barnes, the Communications Minister, proposes a 'tax' of up to £20 per year per broadband connection to pay for this quango.

Have your say and tell the government that they should be making our broadband infrastructure faster and cheaper, not taxing us for using it.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
